data.title: Newly re-opened - same name, very different cuisine.
data.text: Hotel Redland is a historic building and the new owners chose to retain the Whistle Stop name from the previous owners. The cuisine, however, is authentic Spanish. Not Latin - Spanish as in featuring tapas and paella among other offerings. They did keep burgers and chicken, but the main part of the menu is Mediterranean.

owner_response.author: hotelredland, Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your opinion We try to maintain quality in food and services
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: New Owners, New Mediterranean Menu
data.text: I heard this place sold several months ago so we were anxious to try the "new place." With several flags of Spain hanging around the outside of the building, we figured it was tapas and such - we were almost right. Their menu is Mediterranean and everything we tried was very good! We started with an assortment of meats and cheese. Yum. Manchego cheese slices with piles of ham and chorizo ($15) All fantastic and enough for four people. They also brought a bowl of fresh crushed tomato to spread on crusted bread. So fresh! So simple! So good! We tried the fried chick peas with chorizo ($6) as well. Loved it! For our entrees, we had Mahi in butter with fine herbs ($16) and the portion was so generous - and it was cooked perfectly with a delicate flavor. Wow. Chicken paella was enough for two ($18). The star of the show were the potatoes that came as a side to the Mahi. Crispy on the outside, so tender on the inside. Our server Leiley was so kind and patient as she explained what everything was. You must try this "new" place. I can't wait to go back and try the steaks (churrasco, ribeye, and palomilla)!

owner_response.author: hotelredland, Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We really appreciate your opinion. It is of great importance, to know that our food liked them all and the service was up to the standard that you deserve.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Under new management (again)
data.text: We stopped in the other night for drinks and appetizers.  We were surprised to see that it was new owners.  The menu is now Spanish.  We only had drinks a a couple of appetizers which were good but a little salty.  the menu looked very good and we will go back and have dinner soon.  The service was very friendly and accommodating.   One of the appetizers we tried was fried calamari.  The sauces that came with it were very good. We were a bit disappointed to not get the tentacles with it.  Especially since it is a Spanish menu.  Besides a bit too much salt, everything was tasty and nicely presented.

owner_response.author: hotelredland, Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your opinion, we improve every day with your suggestions, our recipe of fried calamari to the Roman does not contemplate the tentacles.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful lunch
data.text: Stopped in for lunch while out running errands in the area. This place is so different from most Homestead restaurants, and that's a good thing. Spanish food done well – the octopus and fried chickpeas were both amazing! My companion got the hamburger – a half pound of tenderloin. He raved about it and the perfect fries that accompanied it. The chef came out to our table to make sure that everything was to our satisfaction. Very friendly staff. We will definitely be back when we're in town again.

owner_response.author: hotelredland, General Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your opinion is very good help for our future and let people know that here there is quality food and careful attention.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Such a disappointment!
data.text:
My family & I loved the outside look of the Whistle Stop. It's located inside a historical Homestead hotel that has many historical pictures of Homestead. Since moving to Homestead 10 years ago we have always wanted to try the Whistle Stop but just never did. Unfortunately our excitement ended all too quickly once we arrived. 
The restaurant has about 6 - 8 tables and the wait staff was non existent. There was an office that had about 8 adults all speaking in Spanish that could see us but none came to see how they could help us. Turns out that they were visiting the new owner of the hotel from out of town.
When we were seated our waitress only complained about the new owner and how he didn't speak English and she couldn't communicate with him. She went on & on about the owner & his visitors. 
After ordering & receiving our food my family of 4 just stared at our food. The vegetables were straight out of a frozen bag that were microwaved. The rest of the food was so bland and cold that we just paid the bill and left. We were so disappointed in the lack of quality of food and the unprofessional character of the wait staff. We were the only people in the restaurant that night and now I see why.

owner_response.author: hotelredland, General Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We regret that it happened, the new administration began in August of this year, and opened the restaurant of Spanish food, we invite you to taste our new offer
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food but very slow service!
data.text:
The food was good... but it took forever to be served!
The waiters were nice but very slow... They gave as a pretext for the slow service that there was a big group of people (apparently approx. 10), even if the rest of the restaurant was almost empty!
They also forgot the drinks order of the table next to us... They were so slow that some people left the restaurant because they still hadn't receive the menu after several minutes.

owner_response.author: hotelredland, General Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text: The hotel is under a new administration and we have a new chef specialized in Spanish food of Mediterranean origin.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: key lime pie to die for!!
data.text:
This restaurant serves food that tastes fresh and homemade.  We had the meatloaf and veggies (special of the night) and it was sooooo good!  A bit of a wait though.  I had to try a key lime pie at least once while in Florida so I tried theirs and it was bright and refreshing!  There was a sweet ZING to the lime that was wonderful.  My better half, who doesn't like anything unless it's drowned in chocolate, even wanted some after he tried mine.  Since then I've tried other restaurants but the recipe just wasn't nearly as good!  
The only qualifier I have here is the motel/restaurant was just sold and is under new management so I don't know if they will change things a lot, for better or worse.  I was sure good when we were there!

owner_response.author: hotelredland, General Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
The hotel is under a new administration and we have a new chef specialized in Spanish food of Mediterranean origin.
Our food is prepared with fresh products, of good quality and we strive to give a good service. We wait for you to delight your palate with our food.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ok....but nothing great
data.text:
Ok food, really great service but restaurant smells its age and food takes forever to be served....
Food below average but again awesome service!

owner_response.author: hotelredland, General Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text: The hotel is under a new administration and we have a new chef specialized in Spanish food of Mediterranean origin.Our food is prepared with fresh products, of good quality and we strive to give a good service. We wait for you to delight your palate with our food.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food
data.text: Cozy little restaurant inside a hotel/bed and breakfast. Our group loved it so much we came two days in a row. Just enough variety, amazing quality. The vegetable sides are local and very yummy (try zucchini and roasted potatoes). Steak is definitely the way to go.

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for you and your group coming two nights in a row. 
I hope you enjoy the rest of your travels.. We appreciate you posting and are
Absolutely thrilled you loved your dinners so much! Thanks again
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Brunch
data.text:
Nice place.  Great omelettes.  The sausage and biscuits were very savory.  The price is very affordable.

You feel that you are in the Old West. You could hear the guest walking around.

My kids loved the brunch !!!!!

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks you so much for coming in and posting a review! 
We really appreciate you and are so happy you had a great experience .
Thanks again, it's our pleasure to serve you""
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Traveling through
data.text: Quiet, quaint bed & breakfast with "The Whistle Stop" inside.  Enjoyed our experience.  . . Nothing fancy, just good home cooked meals.

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for stopping by the Whislte Stop and Hotel Redland. We're so pleased that you enjoyed your home cooked meal.
Thank you for taking the time to write a review. Thanks again and we hope you'll come back if your travels bring you back to Homestrad.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A historical hotel.  Great place to visit for the history buff.  Al Capone actually slept there.
data.text: A great place to visit for the history buff.  Al Capone actually slept there.  Nice ambiance and the staff was very nice nice and accommodating.  Really enjoy the food.

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Let me thank you for visiting and posting a review. 
I'm so thrilled that you so enjoyed your meal and the historic charm.
We certainly hope you make it back! Thanks again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Sunday Brunch
data.text: This is the best place for Brunch on a Sunday morning. We love it here. The staff are so nice and welcoming. They have customers that frequent the place and that is a testament to the great food and great service.

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm so thrilled you had such a great experience with our brunch. 
Thank you so much for visiting and for posting a review. 
We really appreciate you.. Please come back. 
Thanks again
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Sunday Brunch Anticipation
data.text: Well here I was just waiting to get down to the Whistle Stop for their much asked about Sunday Brunch. I know there dinners are very good and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. Well my anticipation was as good as it was going to get. Upon our arrival we were greeted with a rather rude direction of where to sit. There was a variety of food but it really lacked any type of real home cooking. Since I am a true southern boy I was really looking forward to some awesome home made biscuits and gravy. I had to wait 30 minutes for the biscuits, When they came out they looked like someone just blobbed the dough on the cooking sheet and threw them in the oven. They tasted so chalky and were very hard. If this is Homestead best country breakfast then Y'all don't know country breakfast. The gravy I am almost sure came from a can at Publix and I should know I buy enough of it. In conclusion everyone can have a bad day but ill be hard pressed to bring my family here again after all the bragging I did and to see the disappointment on their face was not a good experience. The help really needs to be a little more friendlier to those she hasn't seen before. After all that area of south Florida is growing and if this place doesn't get it together they will be left behind. Good Luck Whistle Stop. I hope you can invites me to come back and give it another try

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm so sorry your experience wasn't up to our standards.
I will talk to staff about the service! I can assure you that our brunch is replete with homemade delights. It is our hope you will come back and give us another try. 
Please introduce yourself to Mark or Lynda and we will make sure you leave happy. I look forward to meeting you.
Thank you!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great find.
data.text: It was actually really good. I had the chicken fried steak, and yummy!!  My wife has chicken and dumplings and I nibbled a bit off her too!  Staff were super friendly.

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Wow, what a great review, thank you so much.
We at The Whislte Stip take such pride and pleasure in your dining experience.mour staff wants nothing more than happy customers.
We hope to see you again!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing! Quaint and so friendly!
data.text: Stopping in homestead before tomorrow's trip to the keys. Found The Whistle stop on trip advisor and it was amazing. Just straight up comfort food. It takes a lot to find someone who makes chicken and dumplings that may just be better than mom's....my other half had the chicken fried steak and it was perfectly tender with a great crunch. So many unique things to look at. Great ambiance. The waitress was super friendly. This was a fantastic find for us. The food...100 percent delicious...thank you whistle stop!

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so very much for taking the time to share your experience with us.
We are so pleased you had such a great meal and visit. Please come back. We would love to see you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Brunch
data.text:
Not the 5 I envisioned after reading reviews ok but not awsome. Staff was nice and friendly.
Perhaps dinner freshly prepared would get a better  rating but brunch (while a  good variety and good fresh omlete for us, ) for the rest might as well go  golden  corral.

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for posting a review. I appreciate it. Please come back and give us another try. Please let us know who you are when you come in. I'm sure you will go away happy.  Thx
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Unexpected Find
data.text: Great place, Very unexpected quality. Service is not what you expect but it fits in. Put this place on your list to visit this year

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
First let me thank you for posting yur review.
We work so hard to make our guests happy with our quality of food and service.
You make it all worth it! Please do come back and visit us again,
Thank you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friday Fish Fry
data.text: We were in the Homestead area on a Friday and stopped at the Whistle Stop which is in the quaint Hotel Redland on 5 S. Flagler. street. My wife and had the fish fry special [cod] and it was prepared perfectly. We had an appetizer of Calamari and it was superb. Michelle was our waitress- excellent. ty

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are so please you enjoyed your dinners and so pleased you found us!
Thank you so much for posting a review. Please come back and visit us again,

Thanks!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Place to Stopby
data.text:
The Whistle Stop was a great place to drop by for a late dinner. We swung by and had a hard time parking (in the back, shares it with the Inn) but once inside it was very charming.  Everyone seemed so at home and the service was very attentive and pleasant.  We arrived about 30minutes before closing but they didnt make us feel rushed at all. Food was pretty good, sorry I didnt get a chance to try out their Soup Of the Day (split pea & bacon) but Im happy to see a local restaurant selling out, it means good business and good food!!

All & all the food was good but the service and atmosphere really was worth the visit. The owner was incredibly helpful with local information for us newcomers.

owner_response.author: HoteLynda, Guest Relations Manager at The Whistle Stop, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We are so thrilled that you found us and even happier that you  had such a pleasant dining experience. Our guests are verry special to us.
I am so sorry we were out of the soup of the day, it is a popular ask!
Thank you for taking the time to post a review, we so appreciate it!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
